title: missionaries
comment: Those called and commissioned by God to fulfil specific tasks, especially that of taking the gospel to those who have not heard it. Missionaries may be sent to other towns, cities or nations, or may be called to fulfil their task closer to home.

children.title: missionaries, call of
children.comment: God calls and sends out his people into the world. All believers are called to share the good news of the gospel, though some are specially commissioned by God, confirmed by the church and compelled by the gospel message to missionary service.

children.title: The call to all God's people
Those sent to their own people

seealsos.comment: Jeremiah's ministry extended further but was primarily to his own people, Judah

primaryrefs.comment: A priest from Samaria returns to teach the resettled population about the LORD.

secondaryrefs.comment: Amos, from Judah, is sent to the northern kingdom of Israel.

primaryrefs.comment: Healing and deliverance accompanies preaching as part of the disciples' mission.

seealsos.comment: During Jesus Christ's earthly ministry the disciples' mission was limited to Israel

children.title: The call confirmed by the church

seealsos.comment: Paul's call to be a missionary to the Gentiles is communicated through Ananias
Paul's mission to the Gentiles is recognised by the other apostles.

primaryrefs.comment: Persecution drove the early church to wider mission.

seealsos.comment: Joseph sold into slavery in Egypt
Daniel among those taken into exile in Babylon
Priscilla and Aquila left Rome because of persecution.

children.title: missionaries, task of
children.comment: God commits various tasks to his servants. A principal task of those sent by God is to take the good news of the gospel to those who have not heard it, and so to be a means through which others come to faith.

children.title: Calling people to turn to God

secondaryrefs.comment: Moses is sent by God to Pharoah
The eastern tribes complete their mission to help the others take possession of Canaan
Gideon is sent by God against the Midianites
Saul is given the task of destroying the Amalekites
Samuel is sent by God to anoint David as king
Cyrus is appointed to bring deliverance from Babylon.

children.title: missionaries, support for
children.comment: Though facing hardships, missionaries receive strength from God to enable them to carry out their task. They are entitled, too, to receive support, encouragement and financial assistance from other believers.

children.title: The Holy Spirit gives power to witness
Missionaries supported by the sending church
Missionary work supported by church leaders
Missionaries encouraged by visits and news
